content.rendered: The 10th edition of the Smile International Film Festival for Children and Youth (SIFFCY), held in partnership with the European Union, was a grand success, marking a significant milestone in the journey of this one-of-its-kind festival. Hosted from April 9th to 15th, 2024, this year’s festival was celebrated in New Delhi and over 100 other locations across India, reaching more than 500,000 young viewers. This year’s festival showcased over 150 films from 50 countries, offering a diverse range of genres, including feature films, short films, documentaries, and animations. In addition to film screenings, SIFFCY 2024 featured 50 workshops, masterclasses, and panel discussions, engaging young minds in various creative and educational activities. The event also included the participation of over 50 national and international professionals, jurors, and filmmakers from 12 different countries, with 100 young jurors from 10 countries participating virtually. SIFFCY was created with the vision to engage, educate, and empower young minds through the medium of good cinema. This initiative by Smile Foundation uses the powerful tool of cinema to impart life lessons, inspire creativity, and foster a deeper understanding of social issues among children and youth. By showcasing films from around the world and hosting workshops, panel discussions, and masterclasses, SIFFCY provides a platform for young audiences to explore diverse cultures, perspectives, and ideas.
